intro: Scorzonera pseudodivaricata, commonly known as the false two-branched scorzonera, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and basal leaves that are often lobed or divided. The plant produces yellow flowers that are typically arranged in a composite head, typical of the Asteraceae family. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. Scorzonera pseudodivaricata is often found in alpine meadows and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
